title: Software Engineer - Full Stack Robotics Intern Summer 2025
description:
**About Us**
============


Reframe Systems is on a mission to build net-zero carbon housing for all, at massive scale. To achieve our mission, we need to make net-zero carbon housing more affordable and we are re-imagining how housing is designed and built. Our modular building platform and highly-automated production system will drive down cost, delivery time, and embodied carbon for ADUs and multifamily housing. We are setting up our first software driven factory in the greater Boston area (Andover, MA), and have a roadmap to scale our presence nationally. We are disrupting assembly line manufacturing for housing production and are backed by leading VC firms in the industrial and construction space.

**What We're Looking For**
==========================


We are looking for a robotics software engineer intern or co-op to help us design and build a re-imagined, carbon conscious, highly-automated, offsite construction micro-factory. The ideal candidate has passion for programming as a tool to solve real-world problems. Candidates with prior experience in robotics or embedded-systems are preferred (academic or otherwise), and all candidates with software experience and a passion to learn will be considered. Candidates should be eager to collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of industry-veteran roboticists, architects and engineers to tackle hard-problems, designing, prototyping, and testing new manipulation workcells and mobility solutions.

**Responsibilities**
====================

* Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of software for robotic manipulation workcells. Work alongside senior engineers in planning, execution, and analysis of development projects. Gain exposure to real-world software development in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* Collaborate in the design of robotic software components for automated micro-factories. Learn and contribute to the implementation of vision-based algorithms, motion planning problems, physics-based simulation and parametric workflows. Explore and support capabilities in both production and development environments.
* Assist in validating hypotheses through data-driven experimentation. Document and summarize findings, presenting them to the team for collaborative discussion. Contribute to the execution of new ideas, taking them from proof-of-concept to operational stages.

**Basic Qualifications**
========================

* Currently pursuing a degree in Robotics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related STEM discipline.
* Solid programming skills, with a preference for proficiency in C++, Python, and ROS 2.
* Proficiency using Git and operating in a Linux environment. Bonus points for experience in developing with Docker and cloud services (AWS).
* Previous experiences in a professional software development environment, developing open-source software, etc. are a plus. Strong passion for developing software for robotics other multi-disciplinary environments.
* Past involvement in a professional software development setting, including the development of open-source software, is advantageous.
* Strong passion for developing software for robotics other multi-disciplinary environments. is highly valued. Including exposure to robotic simulators and a background in simulation-first development.
* Self-motivated with the ability to independently solve problems. Strong communication skills and the capacity to collaborate effectively within a team.

description:
Overview:

Students who join Chick-fil-A as a **Software Engineer Intern** make real contributions on technical projects that impact the business. They solve problems, design architectures, build features, fix bugs, and troubleshoot issues. This program gives interns the opportunity to leverage software engineering skills in an enterprise environment.  

Our Digital Transformation and Technology (DTT) Software Engineer Internship provides students with the opportunity to build differentiating technology that serve our Restaurant Operators and Team Members, Customers, and our Corporate Staff. Interns will develop their skills in key languages such as Java, Python, Go and JavaScript while working in an agile environment.  

The DTT internship is committed to developing participants personally and professionally. All participants are matched with an Early Talent Coach who supports them in their initiatives and development. Interns learn professionalism, interviewing skills, and curated technical topics. Interns meet with Chick-fil-A executives, DTT leadership, and DTT project leads to learn more about Chick-fil-A culture and key work in progress transformational to the business.
Responsibilities:
* Learn about a variety of Chick-fil-A systems and technologies
* Contribute to current projects or initiatives with guidance from a DTT Early Talent Coach
* Influence new and innovative ways to solve current business and technical challenges
* Build features, fix bugs, troubleshoot issues, and implement solutions for key initiatives

 **Project Examples from Previous Internships:*** Enabling our customers to skip the line by building mobile-thru functionality in the Chick-fil-A App
* UI design and implementation of new features for an internal web application
* Building and deploying APIs to Kubernetes
* Managing and distributing machine learning models to business partners
* Improving performance of ETL data processes

  

The Chick-fil-A Summer Intern Program will run for 11 weeks from May 19, 2025 to August 1, 2025 and Interns will need to live within a commutable distance to the Atlanta Corporate Support Center. We follow our Flexible Future model offers a healthy mix of working in person and virtually, strengthening key elements of the Chick-fil-A culture by fostering collaboration and community.  

All selected candidates are required to complete a recorded video interview and online technical exercise.
Minimum Qualifications:
* Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Software Engineering, Human Computer Interaction, MIS or other related major or other related major at a 4-year University/College
* Expected graduation in Fall 2025, Spring 2026, or Summer 2026 (1 to 2 semesters of school remaining upon completion of the 2025 summer internship)
* Live within a commutable distance to the Atlanta Corporate Support Center for the 11-week program (May 19, 2025 - August 2, 2025)
* CURRENT overall GPA of 3.0


Preferred Qualifications:
* Projects or Internships focused on developing applications using Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, or other Object-Oriented programming language
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills


Major/Concentration: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Software Engineering, Human Computer Interaction, MIS or other related major

* Troubleshoot and help resolve high visibility escalations from the business

* Past Projects or Internships focused on Analytical skills with strong problem-solving capabilities
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills

title: Winter 2025 Operations Research Intern
description:
Kodiak was founded in April 2018 to develop autonomous technology that carries freight forward—so people, partners, and the planet thrive. Navigating highway environments presents vastly different challenges than urban streets. Kodiak’s experienced team has developed the industry’s most advanced technology stack purpose-built specifically for long-haul trucks. From our sensor fusion system that maximizes the value of every sensing modality, to our unique lightweight mapping solution that allows our trucks to navigate ever-changing highway construction zones, our world-class team of industry pioneers is bringing the benefits of autonomy to the $800B a year trucking industry quickly, safely, and efficiently.  

We are seeking an Operations Research Intern to join our Systems Engineering team in January. As part of continuous improvement, Kodiak measures the operational performance of its AV operations and identifies opportunities for improving the AV fleet efficiency and uptime. You will be developing a discrete event simulator that models the operations of a large scale, driverless autonomous vehicle fleet. The simulator will model operational flows of autonomous vehicles based on real-world autonomous vehicle performance data to determine bottlenecks and inefficiencies. You will analyze the fleet operations to identify sensitive performance factors and potential operational optimizations. Your work will be used to inform company growth decision-making, engineering feature prioritization, and operational process optimization.
### **In this role, you will:**

* Develop of features for fleet operations simulator for a large scale, driverless autonomous vehicle deployment
* Perform what-if analysis using the fleet operations simulator
* Communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders
* Identify key performance bottlenecks and partner with stakeholders to develop and implement solutions
* Data Validation & Cleaning of Operations Data
* Analyze fleet operational metrics

### **Qualifications:**

* BS/MS in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or related technical field
* Proficiency in Python
* Strong communication skills for communicating analytical results to stakeholders
* Experience with data visualization
* Familiarity with Discrete Event Simulation tools like simpy
* Knowledge of or experience with operations research

### **Internship Program Details:**

* Start Date: January 2025
* Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; the end date is flexible based on individual needs
* Location: Mountain View, CA
* Housing: interns are responsible for housing

* A fast paced environment where we work with talented, committed and supportive teammates
* Competitive pay
* Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits. A beautiful facility in Mountain View
* We love our dogs, so we are a dog friendly office!
* Free catered lunch.

title: IT OPERATIONS RESEARCH INTERN
description:
***A resume helps you stand out to hiring managers and recruiters; your resume communicates your experience and your brand. While it is not required, we encourage you to include an up-to-date resume along with a completed job application to give you the best opportunity to be considered. A complete resume helps us to better understand your unique background, relevant experiences, and passions. We look forward to learning about you.***  


Norfolk Southern offers a unique opportunity to be part of our proud legacy that spans nearly 200 years. We are a customer-centric, operations-driven team dedicated to advancing safety, serving communities, and driving innovation for tomorrow's rail. As part of Norfolk Southern, you’ll join a collaborative team where there are opportunities for growth across the organization. We are building a culture where everyone can thrive by owning and driving exceptional results, being humble and leading with trust, serving our customers with excellence, and collaborating and coaching to win.  


**A Day in the Life of an Operations Research Intern**  

As an intern work within the Operations Research department, you’ll gain real life experience during your college academic career. You will develop skills related to building optimization models, enhancing existing mathematical models, and conducting data analyses. You’ll gain railroad business knowledge for general service design principles, scheduling, and algorithms.  


**As a Norfolk Southern Intern, you will expect to gain the following experience:**  


* **Hands-on Experience**: engage in meaningful projects that align with your academic and career goals.
* **Mentorship**: benefit from guidance and mentorship from seasoned professionals in your department.
* **Professionally Network:** connect with professionals across various departments, building valuable relationships for your future career.
* **Learning Opportunities:** access training and development resources to enhance your skills and knowledge.
* **Inclusive Environment:** join a diverse and inclusive workplace that values collaboration and innovation.

  


**Responsibilities**
* Assist with building new optimization models, enhancing the existing mathematical models, and conducting data analyses.
* Work on development of decision support software (DSS) to improve assets utilization and to reduce operating cost.

  


**Education Required**
* Advanced degree, e.g., Ph.D. or M.S. in operations research, industrial engineering, information systems, mathematics, statistics, or other science and engineering fields.
* Active enrolled student during the months of January through April 2025

  


**Skills Required**
* 1+ year experience in developing decision support systems using operations research models.

  


**Skills Preferred:**
* Experience in developing decision support systems using operations research models.
* Gurobi, CPLEX, or other optimization solvers.
* One or more programming languages such as Python, Java, or C/C++.
* Statistical analysis tool such as R or MS Excel.
* Database programming languages such as SQL or NoSQL.
* Machine learning, neural network, and deep learning.
* Simulation with AnyLogic or ARENA.

  

  

**Work Conditions**  

Location: Atlanta, GA  

Environment: Hybrid (two days in office; three days remote)  

Duration: 12 weeks  

Schedule: Monday through Friday; 9AM -5PM  

**Company Overview**
Since 1827, Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) and its predecessor companies have safely moved the goods and materials that drive the U.S. economy. Today, it operates a customer-centric and operations-driven freight transportation network. Committed to furthering sustainability, Norfolk Southern helps its customers avoid 15 million tons of yearly carbon emissions by shipping via rail. Its dedicated team members deliver more than 7 million carloads annually, from agriculture to consumer goods, and is the largest rail shipper of auto products and metals in North America. Norfolk Southern also has the most extensive intermodal network in the eastern U.S., serving a majority of the country’s population and manufacturing base, with connections to every major container port on the Atlantic coast as well as the Gulf of Mexico and Great Lakes.  


At Norfolk Southern, we believe in celebrating our individuality. By leveraging the unique backgrounds and viewpoints of our employees, we can create a culture of innovation, respect, and inclusion. We know that employees thrive in a workplace where differing viewpoints, ideas, and experiences are freely shared and valued. As such, we encourage all employees to contribute their distinctive skills and capabilities to our organization.  


**Equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Together, we power progress.**
